titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the New York Provincial Congress certificate of appointment 1977.107
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-09T15:58-0500

did.unittitle: New York Provincal Congress certificate of appointment
did.abstract: A certificate of appointment issued by the New York Provincial Congress, dated August 22, 1775. The certificate appoints the unnamed appointee to a position in the New York Militia. The certificate is blank, listing neither the name of the appointee nor the office to which the appointee is chosen. The certificate is signed at the bottom by Nathaniel Woodhull, president of the New York Provincial Congress.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The certificate was officially accessioned in 1977.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); New York Provincial Congress certificate of appointment, 1977.107, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
